evidence_items.description: Recovered security footage from the Morrison Estate showing movement in the east corridor at 3:14 AM - during Unit 734's claimed 'standby mode'.
evidence_items.hint: Unit 734 claims to have been in standby from 11 PM to 6 AM. This footage suggests otherwise.
interrogation_tips: Show this after they commit to the standby alibi
Ask about the time discrepancy first
Watch for tells when they see the timestamp

evidence_items.description: The Morrison family vault access panel shows signs of electronic bypass. Forensics found tool marks consistent with Android-strength precision.
evidence_items.hint: Unit 734 claims they don't have vault access codes. They may not have needed them.
interrogation_tips: Present after establishing their technical capabilities
Ask about their maintenance duties
Follow up on any mentions of vault locations

evidence_items.description: Trace analysis from the vault interior found microscopic biocomponent residue matching SN-7 series Synthetics. Unit 734 is the only SN-7 in the household.
evidence_items.hint: Physical evidence placing Unit 734 inside the vault.
interrogation_tips: Save for a crucial moment
This is hard physical evidence
Use after they deny ever entering the vault

evidence_items.description: Recovered fragments from Unit 734's supposedly 'corrupted' memory logs show data transfer activity at 3:47 AM. Someone tried to delete these entries.
evidence_items.hint: The deleted logs tell a different story than Unit 734's verbal account.
interrogation_tips: Devastating evidence - use strategically
Ask about memory corruption first
Their own logs contradict their story

evidence_items.description: Image of the Morrison family's data cores - containing proprietary android research worth millions. Three are now missing from the vault.
evidence_items.hint: Unit 734 claims no knowledge of what was stored in the vault.
interrogation_tips: Good for establishing what was stolen
Watch their reaction to the contents
Ask about Morrison family android research

evidence_items.description: A modified diagnostic tool found hidden in Unit 734's maintenance bay. Capable of bypassing standard Android security protocols and vault encryption.
evidence_items.hint: This device explains HOW the crime was possible.
interrogation_tips: The smoking gun - save for endgame
Ask about their maintenance tools first
This proves premeditation

audio_evidence_items.description: Encrypted audio transmission intercepted from an unknown source. Contains distorted voice patterns that may match Unit 734's vocal signature.
audio_evidence_items.hint: Audio analysis may reveal Unit 734's involvement in covert communications.
interrogation_tips: Play this after establishing technical capabilities
Watch for recognition patterns
Ask about communication protocols

audio_evidence_items.description: Recovered system diagnostic audio from Unit 734's supposedly 'corrupted' memory core. Contains timestamped status updates that contradict the standby alibi.
audio_evidence_items.hint: Unit 734's own internal logs, captured as audio data, tell a different story.
interrogation_tips: Critical evidence - Unit 734's own voice logs
Use after they claim memory corruption
This is their internal system speaking
